info.name: Rubrik v2 REST API
info.description:
Copyright © 2017-2018 Rubrik Inc. [Legal](#section/Legal)

# Introduction

Welcome to the Rubrik™ REST API documentation.

The Rubrik REST API provides a RESTful interface for working with Rubrik clusters and Rubrik Edge virtual appliances. The Rubrik REST API can be used to query, configure, and control nearly all of the operations of the Rubrik software.

Through authenticated and encrypted interaction with the Rubrik REST API server, perform any of the operations that are available through the Rubrik web UI and many bulk-type operations that might otherwise be difficult or impossible to perform.

This documentation provides reference information and examples of typical workflows for the Rubrik REST API. For more detailed information about working with Rubrik clusters and Rubrik Edge virtual appliances refer to the *Rubrik User Guide*.

A quick way to become familiar with the Rubrik REST API, is to use the Rubrik REST API Explorer. [OpenAPI](#section/OpenAPI) describes this tool.

Refer to the [changelog](#section/Changelog) to see information about changes within this version of the Rubrik REST API.

# Changelog

Revisions are listed with the most recent revision first.

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.2.0
## Deprecation:

## New features and improvements:
 * Added new endpoint
   `POST /sla_domain/{id}/replicated_objects/manage_snapshot_retention` to
   modify the retention of existing policy based snapshots of objects being
   replicated to the current cluster.
 * Added an optional query parameter
   `should_apply_to_existing_snapshots` to `PATCH /sla_domain/{id}` to
   apply the new SLA configuration to existing snapshots of data sources
   retained by the specified SLA Domain.
 * Add two optional parameters `resourcePoolId` and `clusterId` in the request
   body of endpoint `POST /vmware/vm/{id}/export` to enable export virtual
   machine to cluster or resource pool.
### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik version 5.1.0
## Deprecation:

## Feature Additions/improvements:
* Added optional field archivalTieringSpec to ArchivalSpec to support archival
  tiering. This enables the user to configure either Instant Tiering or Smart
  Tiering (with a corresponding minimum accessible duration) on an SLA domain
  with archival configured to an Azure archival location.
* Added optional field logConfig to SlaDomainSummaryV2, SlaDomainDefinitionV2
  and SlaDomainPatchDefintionV2 to support CDP (ctrlc). The parameters
  distinguish SLAs with CDP enabled from SLAs with CDP disabled, and enable
  users to specify log retention time. The field also provides an optional
  frequency parameter whhich can be used by Oracle and SQL Server log backups.
* Added optional field logRetentionLimit to ReplicationSpec to support
  CDP replication. The field gives the retention limit for logs at the
  specified location.
* Added new optional query parameters 'data_sources' and 'snapshot_ids' to
  'GET /sla_domain' endpoint. This allows users to filter SLA Domains based
  on whether they can be assigned to specified data sources and snapshots.
* Added new tag `/vmware/vm/` for VMware virtual machine endpoints.
* Added new endpoint `/vmware/vm/{id}/mount` for live mount under /vmware/vm/
  tag. The endpoint takes in a required body parameter MountSnapshotJobConfigV2,
  which includes a snapshot ID and timestamp. When the snapshot ID is passed
  without a timestamp, this endpoint triggers a live mount using the given
  snapshot ID. When this endpoint is passed a recovery point or a recovery
  point and snapshot ID, the endpoint triggers a live mount using the point
  in time (PIT) for recovery. Calling this endpoint without a recovery point
  or a snapshot ID triggers a PIT live mount that uses the most recent time
  available.
* Added new endpoint `/vmware/vm/{id}/instant_recover` for instant recovery
  with PIT support. Endpoint follows the same conventions as the mount endpoint
  described above. The endpoint takes in a required body parameter
  InstantRecoveryJobConfigV2, which includes a snapshot ID and timestamp. When
  the snapshot ID is passed without a timestamp, this endpoint triggers an
  instant recovery using the given snapshot ID. When this endpoint is passed a
  recovery point or a recovery point and snapshot ID, the endpoint triggers an
  instasnt recovery using the point in time (PIT) for recovery. Calling this
  endpoint without a recovery point or snapshot ID triggers a PIT instant
  recovery that uses the most recent time available.
* Added new endpoint `/vmware/vm/{id}/export` for export under /vmware/vm/
  tag. The endpoint takes in a required body parameter 
  ExportSnapshotJobConfigV2, which includes a snapshot ID and timestamp. When
  the snapshot ID is passed without a timestamp, this endpoint triggers an
  export using the given snapshot ID. When this endpoint is passed a recovery
  point or a recovery point and snapshot ID, the endpoint triggers an export 
  using the point in time (PIT) for recovery. Calling this endpoint without a
  recovery point or a snapshot ID triggers a PIT export that uses the most 
  recent time available.
* Added an optional field 'isRetentionLocked' to 'POST /sla_domain' and
  'PATCH /sla_domain/{id}' to allow users to manage the Retention Lock
  capabilities of an SLADomain.

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.2.0
New features and improvements:
* Added POST operation for the endpoint `/sla_domain/assign_to_snapshot` to
  assign an SLA Domain to a list of snapshots. Snapshots can be on-demand
  or policy-based.
* Added GET operation the endpoint `/sla_domain/request/{id}` to query on
  the status of async request triggered via any of the `sla_domain/`
  endpoints.

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.0.3
## Deprecation:

## New features and improvements:

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.0.2
## Deprecation:

## New features and improvements:

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.0.1
## Deprecation:

## New features and improvements:

### Changes to V2 API in Rubrik Version 5.0.0
Initial GA release.

New features:
* Modified the `/sla_domain` endpoints to add support for weekly and quarterly
  time units.

# OpenAPI
The Rubrik REST API specification conforms to the OpenAPI 2.0 Specification. Tools that work with the OpenAPI 2.0 Specification can be used with the Rubrik REST API specification.

Development releases (pre-1.0) of the Rubrik REST API specification made reference to 'swagger'. The previous release of the OpenAPI 2.0 Specification was named the Swagger 1.2 Specification.

Download the Rubrik REST API specification for your tools. [Download](./api-docs)

## Rubrik REST API Explorer
The Rubrik REST API Explorer is a browser-based API client hosted by the Rubrik cluster. The Explorer has the Rubrik REST API specification built in. You can use the Explorer to try out Rubrik REST API calls and view the responses.

**IMPORTANT:** The Explorer interacts with the Rubrik cluster through the API calls you make. Use care when making calls that modify or delete configurations and data.

To access the Rubrik REST API Explorer, click: [Rubrik REST API Explorer](./playground/)

# SQL Server databases

## Assigning SLA Domains to SQL Server Objects

To assign SLA Domain properties to multiple objects, send a POST request to the [`/mssql/sla_domain/assign`](#operation/assignMssqlSlaPropertiesAsync) endpoint. Note that this endpoint is asynchronous. The assignment does not complete until the background operation performing the assignment completes. Use this endpoint to provide a fast return time without a guarantee of strong consistency.

**Example:** Assigning an SLA Domain with ID $slaId to a list of objects - $id1, $id2

```bash
curl -X POST -d \
  '{
    "ids": ["$id1", "$id2"],
    "configuredSlaDomainId": "$slaDomainId"
  }' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/mssql/sla_domain/assign"
```

# SLA Domains

Rubrik clusters provide automated data management and protection through SLA Domains.
An SLA Domain defines the data management and protection policies for their assigned snappables (virtual machines, file systems, and applications).

To provide policy based management and protection of a snappable, add the snappable to an SLA Domain, or to multiple SLA Domains.

## Retrieving SLA Domains

Before assigning snappables to SLA Domains, get a list of the SLA Domains that exist on a Rubrik cluster. For a new Rubrik cluster, the list shows only the default SLA Domains. When custom SLA Domains are added to the Rubrik cluster, the list is modified to include those SLA Domains.

**Example:** Retrieving SLA Domains from a Rubrik cluster

Send a GET request to [`/sla_domain`](#operation/querySlaDomainV2).

```bash
curl -X GET "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain"
```

The Rubrik REST API server returns a `ListResponse` object of all SLA Domains. A `ListResponse` object includes all of the SLA Domains on the Rubrik cluster, including SLA Domains created through a v1 SLA Domain endpoint. The `ListResponse` object always includes the default SLA Domains: Gold, Silver, and Bronze.

```bash
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "$gold_sla_id",
      "name": "Gold"
    },
    {
      "id": "$silver_sla_id",
      "name": "Silver"
    },
    {
      "id": "$bronze_sla_id",
      "name": "Bronze"
    }
  ],
  "hasMore": false,
  "total": 3
}
```

For more details about an SLA domain, send a GET request to the `/sla_domain/{id}` endpoint and provide the ID of the SLA domain, for example:  [`/sla_domain/{id}`](#operation/getSlaDomainV2)

```bash
curl -X GET "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/$bronze_sla_id"
```
The Rubrik REST API server responds with the details of the specified SLA Domain.

```bash
{
  "id": "$bronze_sla_id",
  "primaryClusterId": "$cluster_id",
  "name": "Bronze",
  "frequencies": [
    "daily": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 32
    },
    "weekly": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 12,
      "dayOfWeek": "Monday"
    },
    "monthly": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 12,
      "dayOfMonth": "LastDay"
    },
    "quarterly" {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 2,
      "quarterStarts": "January",
      "dayOfQuarter": "LastDay"
    },
    "yearly": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 2,
      "yearStarts": "January",
      "dayOfYear": "LastDay"
    }
  ],
  "allowedBackupWindows": [],
  "firstFullAllowedBackupWindows": [],
  "archivalSpecs": [],
  "replicationSpecs": [
    {
      "locationId": "$repl_location_id",
      "retentionLimit": 0
    }
  ],
  "numDbs": 0,
  "numFilesets": 7,
  "numLinuxHosts": 3,
  "numWindowsHosts": 2,
  "numVms": 1,
  "isDefault": false,
  "uiColor": "#cc8366",
  "showAdvancedUi": false,
  "advancedUiConfig": []
}
```

## Working with SLA Domains

To work with an SLA Domain, obtain the `id` of that SLA Domain. As described in [Retrieving SLA Domains](#section/SLA-Domains/Retrieving-SLA-Domains), start by sending a GET request to [`/sla_domain`](#operation/querySlaDomainV2).

The Rubrik REST API server responds with a `ListResponse` object that contains all of the SLA Domains on the specfied Rubrik cluster. From that list object, find the data array element that has the `name` value of the selected SLA Domain. In the same array element as the `name` value, note the value of the `id` string.

## Creating SLA Domains

To create an SLA domain send a POST request to [`/sla_domain`](#operation/createSlaDomainV2). Include the attributes for the SLA Domain in the request body.

The following table describes the required and optional attributes to include in the request body when creating an SLA Domain.

| Attribute | Req'd | JSON Type | Description |
| ------ | --- | ----- | ----------- |
| `name` | Yes | String | Name of the SLA Domain.  |
| `frequencies` | Yes | Object | Each member defines a policy by specifying: `frequency`, and `retention`. For `weekly`, it defines one more field `dayOfWeek`. For `monthly`, it defines one more field `dayOfMonth`. For `quarterly`, it defines two more fields `firstQuarterStartMonth` and `dayOfQuarter`. For `yearly`, it defines two more fields `yearStartMonth` and `dayOfYear`. Requires at least one member in the object.  |
| `allowedBackupWindows` | Yes | Array | Each member defines a backup window using values for `startTimeAttributes` and `durationInHours`. The time specified in `startTimeAttributes` uses the Rubrik cluster time zone. To specify multiple backup windows, add an array member for each window. To create an SLA Domain without a backup window, specify a null array value: `[]`.  |
| `firstFullAllowedBackupWindows` | Yes | Array | Each member defines a period when first full backups are allowed by specifying: `startTimeAttributes` and `durationInHours`. Several first full backup windows can be specified by adding an array member for each one. Create an SLA Domain without a first full backup window by specifying a null array value: `[]`.  |
| `localRetentionLimit` | No | String | Specify an integer value to set the number of days to retain a local copy of a snapshot. When an archival location is specified, specify `0` to enable Instant Archiving. |
| `archivalSpecs` | No | Array | Defines the archival location for the SLA Domain by specifying: `locationId` and `archivalThreshold`. Currently limited to one array member. |
| `replicationSpecs` | No | Array | Defines the replication location for the SLA Domain by specifying: `locationId` and `retentionLimit`. Currently limited to one array member. |

The following table describes the required attributes for each time unit in `frequency`
| Attribute | Req'd | JSON Type | Description |
| ------ | --- | ----- | ----------- |
| `dayOfWeek` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `Monday`, `Tuesday`, `Wednesday`, `Thursday`, `Friday`, `Saturday` and `Sunday`.  |
| `dayOfMonth` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `FirstDay`, `Fifteenth` and `LastDay`.  |
| `firstQuarterStartMonth` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `January`, `February`, `March`, `April`, `May`, `June`, `July`, `August`, `September`, `October`, `November` and `December`. |
| `dayOfQuarter` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `FirstDay` and `LastDay`. |
| `yearStartMonth` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `January`, `February`, `March`, `April`, `May`, `June`, `July`, `August`, `September`, `October`, `November` and `December`.  |
| `dayOfYear` | Yes | String | Defines as enum and only accepts `FirstDay` and `LastDay`. |

**Example:** Creating an SLA Domain for daily backups

Create an SLA Domain that takes a backup once a day and retains the backup for seven days. Do not set a backup window or a first full backup window. Do not include archival or replication.

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
  "name": "Daily SLA",
  "frequencies": [
    "daily": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 7
    }
  ],
  "allowedBackupWindows": [],
  "firstFullAllowedBackupWindows": [] }' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain"
```
The response confirms the attributes of the SLA Domain and provides the `id` of the new SLA Domain.

```bash
{
  "id": "$sla_id",
  "name": "Daily SLA",
  "frequencies": [
    "daily": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 7
    }
  ],
  "allowedBackupWindows": [],
  "firstFullAllowedBackupWindows": []
}
```

## Patching SLA Domains

To patch the attributes of an SLA domain, send a PATCH request to
[`/sla_domain/{id}`](#operation/patchSlaDomainV2). Include in the request body
only the attributes that needs to be patched.

**Example:** Patching the daily backup SLA Domain

Patch the SLA Domain that was created in [Creating SLA Domains](#section/SLA-Domains/Creating-SLA-Domains) to change the archival specifications.

```bash
curl -X PATCH \
  -d '{
  "archivalSpecs": [
    {
        "locationId": "some-valid-archived-location-id",
        "archivalThreshold": 14
    }
  ]}' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/$sla_id"
```
The response confirms the new attribute and also includes the other
attributes that were not changed.

```bash
{
  "id": "$sla_id",
  "name": "Daily SLA",
  "frequencies": [
    "daily": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 7
    }
  ],
  "archivalSpecs": [
    {
      "locationId": "some-valid-archived-location-id",
      "archivalThreshold": 14
    }
  ],
  "allowedBackupWindows": [],
  "firstFullAllowedBackupWindows": []
}
```

## Deleting SLA Domains

To delete an SLA Domain send a DELETE request to [`/sla_domain/{id}`](#operation/deleteSlaDomainV2).

**Example:** Deleting an SLA Domain

Delete an SLA Domain with the ID of `$sla_id`.

```bash
curl -X DELETE "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/$sla_id"
```
The Rubrik REST API server responds with HTTP response code 204. This indicates the request succeeded and the response body is empty.

## Pausing SLA Domains

To pause the SLA domain, send a POST request to
[`/sla_domain/{id}`](#operation/pauseSlaDomainV2).
Include the isPaused attribute in the request body to pause or resume the
SLA Domain. Pausing an SLA Domain pauses backup, archival, and replication jobs
for all data sources that are protected by that SLA Domain.

**Example:** Pausing the daily backup SLA Domain

Update the SLA Domain that was created in
[Creating SLA Domains](#section/SLA-Domains/Creating-SLA-Domains) to pause
protection.

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
  "isPaused": true}' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/$sla_id/pause"
```
The response confirms the new attribute and also includes the other
attributes that were not changed.

```bash
{
  "id": "$sla_id",
  "name": "Daily SLA",
  "frequencies": [
    "daily": {
      "frequency": 1,
      "retention": 7
    }
  ],
  "allowedBackupWindows": [],
  "firstFullAllowedBackupWindows": [],
  "isPaused": true
}

```

## Assigning SLA Domain to snappables

For batching multiple assignments, send a POST request to the [`/sla_domain/{id}/assign`](#operation/assignToSlaAsync) endpoint. Note that this endpoint is asynchronous. The assignment does not complete until the background operation performing the assignment completes. Use this endpoint to provide a fast return time without a guarantee of strong consistency.

**Example:** Assigning an SLA Domain with ID $slaId to a list of snappables - $snap1Id, $snap2Id

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
    "managedIds": [$snap1Id, $snap2Id],
    "shouldApplyToExistingSnapshots": false
  }' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/assign"
```

## Querying for SLA Domain assignments

After assigning an SLA Domain to a data source, query for assignment completion by sending a POST request to the [`/sla_domain/pending_assignment`](#operation/getPendingSlaAssignments) endpoint.

**Example:** Querying for assignment on list of data sources - $snap1Id, $snap2Id

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
    "objectIds": [$snap1Id, $snap2Id]
  }' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/pending_assignment"
```

## Assigning SLA Domain to snapshots

To assign an SLA Domain to a list of snapshots, send a POST request
to the [`/sla_domain/assign_to_snapshot`](#operation/assignSlaToSnapshotV2) endpoint.

**Example:** Assigning an SLA Domain with ID $slaId to list of snapshots - $s1Id, $s2Id

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
   "slaDomainId": $slaId
   "snapshotIds": [$s1Id, $s2Id]}' \
   "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/assign_to_snapshot"
```

```bash
{
  "responses": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "status": "string",
      "progress": 0,
      "startTime": "2019-10-29T22:11:35.256Z",
      "endTime": "2019-10-29T22:11:35.256Z",
      "nodeId": "string",
      "error": {
        "message": "string"
      },
      "links": [
        {
          "href": "string",
          "rel": "string"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

The Rubrik REST API server responds with HTTP response code 200 and the
response body containing the details of the async request. The status
of the async request can be checked using
(#operation/getSlaDomainAsyncRequestStatus) defined below

### Query asynchronous request status for Sla Domain operations

To query the request status details of an asynchronous request
that is related to an Sla Domain, send a GET request to
[`/sla_domain/request/{id}`](#operation/getSlaDomainAsyncRequestStatus)

**Example:** Query request status for async request with id: $id

```bash
curl -X GET "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/sla_domain/request/$id"
```

```bash
{
  "id": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "progress": 0,
  "startTime": "2018-10-02T20:33:03.933Z",
  "endTime": "2018-10-02T20:33:03.933Z",
  "nodeId": "string",
  "error": {
    "message": "string"
  },
  "links": [
    {
      "href": "string",
      "rel": "string"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Modify retention of snapshots

To modify the retention of existing policy based snapshots of objects being
replicated to the current cluster to an SLA Domain send a POST request to
[`/sla_domain/{id}/replicated_objects/manage_snapshot_retention`](#operation/manageSnapshotRetention).

```bash
curl -X POST -d \
  '{
    "objectIds": [
        "$object_id1",
        "$object_id2"
    ]
  }' \
  "https://$cluster_address/api/v1/sla_domain/$sla_id/replicated_objects/manage_snapshot_retention"
```
The Rubrik REST API server responds with HTTP response code 202 and the
response body containing the details of the async request. The status of the
async request can be checked using (#operation/getSlaDomainAsyncRequestStatus).

# Virtual machines

The Rubrik cluster protects virtual machines running in a VMware vSphere
environment through the VADP APIs. The Rubrik cluster also works with
the Rubrik Backup Service running on the virtual machine to provide:

* Optimal performance when restoring files and folders to the virtual machine
* Application consistent snapshots of a Windows virtual machine

## Snapshot mount operations
Snapshot mount operations include the following possible actions:
* Mounting a snapshot by using Live Mount
* Exporting a snapshot

### Mounting a snapshot by using Live Mount

Mount a new virtual machine from a snapshot or point-in-time (PIT) by using the Live Mount feature. To use Live Mount, send a POST request to [`/vmware/vm/{id}/mount`](#operation/createMountV2). This request optionally takes the parameters described in the following table. If neither `recoveryPoint` nor `snapshotId` are passed in, we will trigger a PIT Live Mount with the latest recoverable time.

| Name | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| `recoveryPoint` | A point in time to recover to. If this parameter is passed in, we will trigger a PIT Live Mount.
| `snapshotId` | The ID of the snapshot to recover to. If this parameter is passed in and recoveryPoint is not specified, we will trigger a Live Mount using this snapshot.
| `hostId` | The `id` of an ESXi hypervisor. When not specified, the Rubrik cluster uses the original hypervisor. |
| `vmName` | Assigns a specified name to the virtual machine. |
| `dataStoreName` | Obsolete parameter. |
| `disableNetwork` | Determines whether the virtual machine has access to the network. Use `true` to Mount the snapshot with network access disabled. Use `false` to allow the virtual machine to access the network. |
| `removeNetworkDevices` | Determines whether the virtual machine has network devices. Use `true` to remove network devices from the virtual machine. Use `false` to keep the existing network devices. |
| `powerOn` | Determines whether the virtual machine is powered on after mounting. Use `true` to power on the virtual machine. Use `false` to leave the virtual machine powered off after mounting. |

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
     "hostId": "$esxi_id",
     "vmName": "$vm_name",
     "dataStoreName": "$datastore_name",
     "disableNetwork": "$network_state",
     "removeNetworkDevices": "$network_devices_state",
     "powerOn": "$power_state"
  }'\
   "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/vmware/vm/$vm_id/mount"
```

The Rubrik REST API server initiates the asynchronous request task and responds with a task object.

```bash
{
  "id": "$live_mount_task_id",
  "status": "QUEUED",
  "progress": 0,
  "startTime": "$timestamp",
  "links": [
    {
      "href": "https://$cluster_address/api/v1/vmware/vcenter/request/$request_id",
      "rel": "self"
    }
  ]
}
```

### Exporting a snapshot

To export a snapshot send a POST request to [`/vmware/vm/{id}/export`](#operation/createExportV2). This request optionally takes the parameters described in the following table. If neither `recoveryPoint` nor `snapshotId` are passed in, we will trigger a PIT Live Mount with the latest recoverable time.

| Name | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| `recoveryPoint` | A point in time to recover to. If this parameter is passed in, we will trigger a PIT Live Mount.
| `snapshotId` | The ID of the snapshot to recover to. If this parameter is passed in and recoveryPoint is not specified, we will trigger a Live Mount using this snapshot.
| `datastoreId` | The `id` of a datastore for the specified ESXi hypervisor. |
| `vmName` | Assigns a specified name to the virtual machine. |
| `hostId` | The `id` of an ESXi hypervisor. |
| `disableNetwork` | Determines whether the virtual machine has access to the network. Use `true` to Mount the snapshot with network access disabled. Use `false` to allow the virtual machine to access the network. |
| `removeNetworkDevices` | Determines whether the virtual machine has network devices. Use `true` to remove network devices from the virtual machine. Use `false` to keep the existing network devices. |
| `powerOn` | Determines whether the virtual machine is powered on after mounting. Use `true` to power on the virtual machine. Use `false` to leave the virtual machine powered off after mounting. |
| `unregisterVm` | Determines whether to add the exported virtual machine to the vCenter Server inventory. Use `true` to remove the exported virtual machine from the associated vCenter Server inventory. Use `false` to add the exported virtual machine to the associated vCenter Server inventory. |


```bash
curl -X  -d \
 '{
   "datastoreId": "string",
   "vmName": "string",
   "hostId": "string",
   "disableNetwork": true,
   "removeNetworkDevices": true,
   "powerOn": true,
   "unregisterVm": true
 }' \
 "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/vmware/vm/$vm_id/export"

The Rubrik REST API server initiates the asynchronous request task and responds with a task object.

```bash
{
  "id": "$export_task_id",
  "status": "QUEUED",
  "progress": 0,
  "startTime": "$timestamp",
  "links": [
    {
      "href": "https://$cluster_address/api/v1/vmware/vcenter/request/$request_id",
      "rel": "self"
    }
  ]
}
```

### Mounting a snapshot by using Instant Recovery

Replaces a virtual machine by restoring from a snapshot or performing a point-in-time (PIT) recovery by using the Instant Recovery feature. Using Instant Recovery requires a POST request to [`/vmware/vm/{id}/instant_recover`](#operation/createInstantRecoveryV2). When this request does not contain either recoveryPoint or snapshotId, the PIT Instant Recovery uses the latest recoverable time.

| Name | Description |
| `recoveryPoint` | A point in time to recover to. If this parameter is passed in, we will trigger a PIT Instant Recovery.
| `snapshotId` | The ID of the snapshot to recover to. If this parameter is passed in and recoveryPoint is not specified, we will trigger an Instant Recovery using this snapshot.
| `hostId` | The `id` of an ESXi hypervisor. When not specified, the Rubrik cluster uses the original hypervisor. |
| `vmName` | Assigns a specified name to the virtual machine. |
| `removeNetworkDevices` | Determines whether the virtual machine has network devices. Use `true` to remove network devices from the virtual machine. Use `false` to keep the existing network devices. |

```bash
curl -X POST \
  -d '{
     "hostId": "$esxi_id",
     "vmName": "$vm_name",
     "removeNetworkDevices": "$network_devices_state",
  }'\
   "https://$cluster_address/api/v2/vmware/vm/$vm_id/instant_recover"
```

The Rubrik REST API server initiates the asynchronous request task and responds with a task object.

```bash
{
  "id": "$instant_recovery_task_id",
  "status": "QUEUED",
  "progress": 0,
  "startTime": "$timestamp",
  "links": [
    {
      "href": "https://$cluster_address/api/v1/vmware/vcenter/request/$request_id",
      "rel": "self"
    }
  ]
}
```

request.description: Instantly recover a virtual machine from either a snapshot ID or a timestamp using a specified configuration. The Instant Recovery request starts the virtual machine with networking enabled and renames and powers off the source virtual machine, if it still exists.

response.name: Status of the Instant Recovery request.

request.description: Export a virtual machine from a snapshot, using a specified hypervisor host as the datastore.
Create a request to Live Mount a virtual machine from either a snapshot ID or a timestamp using a specified configuration.

response.name: Status of the Live Mount request.

request.description: Delete an SLA Domain from a Rubrik cluster. The SLA Domain must not be assigned to any VMs, filesets or databases.
Retrieve summary information for a specified SLA Domain.

response.name: Object containing information about the SLA Domain

query.description: A Boolean that determines whether the new configuration retains existing snapshots of data sources that are currently retained by this SLA Domain. The value is 'true' by default.

request.description: (DEPRECATED) Patch the properties of an SLA Domain. The recommended endpoint is v3/sla_domain/{id}.

response.name: Object containing the patched SLA Domain.

item.name: Modify the retention of existing policy based snapshots of objects

request.description: Modify the retention of all existing policy based snapshots of the provided objects. This operation is only allowed for objects that are being replicated to the current cluster. This operation runs asynchronously.

response.name: Queued asynchronous requests for modifying retention of existing snapshots of the objects to the specified SLA Domain.

request.description: Pause protection of an SLA Domain.

response.name: Object that contains the paused SLA Domain.

item.name: Assign managed entities to an SLA Domain

request.description: Assign managed entities to the specified SLA Domain. The assignment event runs in the background after this call returns. SLA Domain assignment is not reflected in subsequent calls until the background job is complete. It is not recommended to mix calls to synchronous and asynchronous SLA assignment endpoints.

response.name: Pending SLA Domains resulting from this assignment.

request.description: Create a new SLA Domain on a Rubrik cluster by specifying Domain rules and policies.

response.name: Summary of newly created SLA Domain.

query.description: Limits the information retrieved to those SLA Domains that are associated with the Rubrik cluster ID that is specified by primary_cluster_id. Use **local** for the Rubrik cluster that is hosting the current REST API session.
Limit the list information to those SLA Domains which match the specified SLA Domain 'name' value.
Attribute to use to sort the SLA Domains summary information. Optionally use **_sort_order_** to specify whether to sort in ascending or descending order (This can only be one of name)
Sort order, either ascending or descending. If not specified, SLA Domain summary results will be sorted in ascending order (This can only be one of asc,desc)
Limit the list information to SLA Domains that can be assigned to specified data sources.
Limit the list information to SLA Domains that can be assigned to specified snapshots.

request.description: Retrieve summary information for all SLA Domains.

item.name: Get SLA Domain Async request status

variable.description: (Required) ID assigned to an asynchronous request.

request.description: Retrieve the details of a specified asynchronous task for a SLA Domain assignment or update request.

response.name: Status of a asynchronous request for SLA Domain assignment or update.

item.name: Assign SLA Domain to the snapshots

request.description: Assigns an SLA Domain to a list of snapshots. The SLA Domain manages retention for the snapshots. This is an asynchronous operation.

response.name: Queued asynchronous requests for assigning SLA Domains to snapshots.

item.name: Get pending SLA Domain assignments on selected managed objects

request.description: Retrieve the details of pending SLA Domain assignments on the given managed objects. For objects with pending assignments, return the SLA Domain that is pending. For objects without pending assignments, return the current SLA Domain information. Explicitly list invalid object IDs.

response.name: Pending SLA Domains for the objects in input.

item.name: Assign SLA properties to SQL Server objects

request.description: Assigns SLA Domain properties to SQL Server objects. Hosts and Windows clusters cannot be assigned SLA Domains directly. The SLA Domains are instead applied to the SQL Server child objects within the Host or Windows Cluster object. Newly discovered SQL Server objects within a given Host or Windows Cluster object do not inherit SLA Domain properties from other child SQL Server objects with the same parent object. The assignment event runs in the background after this call returns. SLA Domain assignment is not reflected in subsequent calls until the background job is complete. It is not recommended to mix calls to synchronous and asynchronous SLA assignment endpoints.

response.name: Pending SLA Domains resulting from this assignment.
